title: Representative Learning Design Simulation for Improving Tennis Serve Techniques

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding basic tennis strokes and serve mechanics
context.additional_context: Utilization of low-spec VR simulation tools based on smartphones, offering a three-tier representative learning environment reflecting actual match situations (simple serve, opponent response, three-ball rally).

learning_goals: Learners achieve over 85% accuracy in first/second serve precision within a three-stage simulation environment resembling actual matches
Learners strategically adjust serve angles and landing points to exploit opponents’ weaknesses with over 70% effectiveness

Learners can perform each of the speed serve (within 30 seconds) and accuracy serve (80% target hit rate) strategies five or more times in a badminton simulation and select appropriate serve types based on given situations (score difference, opponent’s defensive position) with 80% accuracy.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
